ygData.subject: Re: [neat] NEAT or HyperNEAT for breve
ygData.msgSnippet: Peter B. and I have been doing some experiments with Breve using the NEAT-Python implementation. It s not a plugin, though. You have to set up a fitness

Subject: Re: [neat] NEAT or HyperNEAT for breve
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=230385553; y=lzPmiAif9tvHnLRsoNy3WE0o41CsNcMm2jxov_U_do3K
X-Yahoo-Profile: fdital

Peter B. and I have been doing some experiments with Breve using the
NEAT-Python implementation. It's not a plugin, though. You have to set
up a fitness function that calls the Breve engine from the command
line and passes the chromosomes by argument. Once the Breve simulation
is finished, it returns the fitness for each individual.

So it's a two-step problem: first set-up your environment within
Breve, as you'd do in a normal experiment; then you define a fitness
function to load that environment every time you need to evaluate the
population. Think of Breve as the "evaluator" and not part of NEAT.
It's a completely separated module.

If you have interest, we can send you the code. It only works in linux
right now, given that you need to use some shell scripts. But I think
it won't be hard to translate that into a bat file.

Cesar

On Thu, Jul 10, 2008 at 11:20 AM, Correy Allen Kowall
<coolbeanskowall@...> wrote:
> Does anyone know of a NEAT or hyperNEAT plugin for the breve
> simulation engine? If not, I will write one, if someone points me
> toward the most solid and lightweight c/c++ version.
> ck
